result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter JA Green appeared by video, in custody at the Lacrosse County Jail.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Peter JA Green. 

22CF44 / 22CF68 / 22CF74 cases called. 

22CF44  
Atty Moefu is heard on waiver. Defendant wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. 
Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Atty Moefu is ready to proceed with arraignment. Atty Moefu waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.  Jury Status to be scheduled for this case. 

22CF68 / 22CF74 
Atty Steiner is heard on warrant status. State requests additional cash $600.00 bond. 
Atty Moefu is heard on bond and requests a signature bond. 
Court orders that bond will leave as is for both cases and no additional bond will be added. 
Court orders warrants in each of these cases will be canceled.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:30 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter JA Green not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Peter JA Green. 

Atty Moefu is heard on defendants non appearance. Atty Moefu informs the court that defendant has been taken into custody in Lacrosse county. JA will get notice to Lacrosse county jail.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:04 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter JA Green appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Peter JA Green. 
     Court sets for prelim. hrg.  Atty. Moefu waives time limits.  Parties agree to prelim. hrg. via zoom.
     Court concludes at 2:07 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Atty. Lui Moefu apptd.

2:42 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter JA Green appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining and attorney. Defendant does qualify for an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

State Public Defender's Office indicates that Mr. Green just phoned their office on this case this morning.  He does qualify for a public defender at this time; however, they are unsure if they will have an attorney for this case today (4/18/22) due to the short notice.

1:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter James Anthony Green appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. DA requests a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  

Defendant is heard. Requests a signature bond.

Court orders a $200.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
